{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient in the case has a history of prostate adenocarcinoma and a lung nodule. To determine if the lung nodule is metastatic, additional findings on CT scans can be evaluated. Option A, 'Popcorn' pattern, is not typically associated with metastatic lung nodules. Option B, Subsolid component, is more commonly seen in primary lung malignancies rather than metastatic nodules. Option C, Extending fine striations, is not specific to metastatic nodules. Option D, Doubling time of < 1 month, is a characteristic of aggressive lung nodules and would be more concerning for metastatic disease. Therefore, the most likely finding on CT scans that would prompt the removal of such nodules is a doubling time of < 1 month. ", "answer_choice": "D"}
